hanzi-su-wiki:
潤

Значения

Становиться влажным, богатеть, получать выгоду; мочить, увлажнять, приносить выгоду; тускнеть, затуманиваться, увлажняться

Мнемоника

Високосный год, наступление которого объявлялось 門 правителем 王 особо. В это время особенно активны стихии и много влаги 氵, что обеспечивает богатый урожай.

Варианты

润

heisig_chinese_memo: Forgetting about the moat, the king stepped out of his gate, landed in the water and got moistened (wet).
heisig_constituent: wet, water, water droplets, water pistol, intercalate, gates, king, jewel, ball
Keyword_KANJIDIC: wet, be watered, profit by, receive benefits, favor, charm, steep
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: смачивать, поливать, прибыль от, получать выгоду, пользу, обаяние, крутой
koohiiStory1: Forgetting about the moat, the king stepped out of his gate and landed in the water. Needless to say he got wet.
koohiiStory2: (I had the same idea as Dingomick) I imagine some prankster who put a bucket full of water on top of the huge gates, so that it would fall on the king as he came through them. See the king now, between the gates, all wet, dripping drops of water.
kunYomi: うるお.う、うるお.す、うる.む
jp_example_words:
潤う(うるおう): to be moist, to be damp, to get wet, to profit by, to be watered, to receive benefits, to favor, to charm, to steepen
利潤(りじゅん): profit, returns
jp_readingExamples: 潤む (うる.む), 潤う (うるお.う), 潤す (うるお.す)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tsunami at the gate of the king makes sure all of his plants get watered. The gate prevents the tsunami from damaging anything inside the king’s home, and the plants around the gate get watered by the water of the tsunami.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Hear the tsunami crash into the gate as you see the water slosh around and make sure that all of the king’s plants get good and watered.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: These plants are getting watered in June (じゅん), the month they need watering the most. June is a hot month, so it’s good that this tsunami came and got the king’s plants watered when it did.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Again, watch and hear the tsunami crashing into the gate and getting the plants watered. This time, remember that the month is June and it is very hot and sticky outside. You’re sweating and very hot.
Ru_Russian: мокнуть, быть влажным, поливаться, купаться в (деньгах, привелегиях, расположении)
Ru_Meaning: wet, be watered, profit by, receive benefits, favor, charm, steep

Ru_trainchinese: rùn: (глаг/прил/сущ) увлажнять; улучшать, оттачивать; влажный; гладкий, глянцевый; выгода
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the extra (閏) water (氵) moistens
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: There are lots of scams in American history like water gate, but perhaps the most famous is when Monica Lewinsky moistened Bill Clinton's jewels.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and " leap ", the original meaning is to moisturize and moisturize. "Shuowen": "Water is said to run down. From the water, leap sound." "Yi‧Shuo Gua": "Wind to disperse, rain to moisten it."

" Run " can mean humidity. "Huainanzi‧ Shuo Lin Xun": "Mountains are steamed with clouds, and pillars are moistened."

" Run " also means fine and smooth. "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "The jade is in the mountains and the vegetation is moist, the pearls grow in the depths, but the cliffs do not wither."

" Run " also refers to rain. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty: The Biography of Zhong Liyi": "However, there is no big run from Miyun in the past."

" Run " can also express grace. "Huainanzi·Thai Clan": "Yao rules the world, politics and education are peaceful, and morality is harmonious."

" Run " also means warm and moist. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long‧ Ming Poetry": "So Pingzi gets its elegance, and Shu Ye contains its luster."

" Run " can also refer to goods and benefits. Zhang Huangyan of the Ming Dynasty "An Answer to Cao Yunlin's Supervision of the Army": "Xu Xiongshi meets the brothers in Ruan Tu, don't make a difference, why Liang Boluan meets Fan Laiwu?"
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and " run ", the original meaning is to moisturize and moisturize.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「閏」聲，本義為滋潤、使潤濕。《說文》：「水曰潤下。从水，閏聲。」《易‧說卦》：「風以散之，雨以潤之。」

　　「潤」可表示潮濕。《淮南子‧說林訓》：「山雲蒸，柱礎潤。」

　　「潤」也表示細膩光滑。《荀子‧勸學》：「玉在山而草木潤，淵生珠而崖不枯。」

　　「潤」亦指雨水。《後漢書‧鍾離意傳》：「而比日密雲，遂無大潤。」

　　「潤」還可表示恩澤。《淮南子‧泰族訓》：「堯治天下，政教平，德潤洽。」

　　「潤」也表示溫潤。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧明詩》：「故平子得其雅，叔夜含其潤。」

　　「潤」也可指財物、好處。明張煌言〈答曹雲林監軍書〉：「徐兄適會弟于阮途，勿克稍為分潤，何梁伯鸞偏遇范萊蕪乎？」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「閏」聲，本義為滋潤、使潤濕。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 閏 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 閏 [ rùn ] intercalary; extra, surplus
①不幹枯，溼燥適中：溼潤。潤澤。滋潤。
②加油或水使不幹枯：潤腸。潤滑。浸潤。
③細膩光滑：光潤。滑潤。珠圓玉潤。
④使有光澤，修飾：潤飾。潤色。
⑤利益：利潤。分潤。
⑥以財物酬人：潤筆。
(Simplified: 润)

利潤(りじゅん): profit, returns

從「 水 」，「 閏 」聲，本義為滋潤、使潤濕。《說文》：「水曰潤下。从水，閏聲。」《易‧說卦》：「風以散之，雨以潤之。」 「 潤 」可表示潮濕。《淮南子‧說林訓》：「山雲蒸，柱礎潤。」 「 潤 」也表示細膩光滑。《荀子‧勸學》：「玉在山而草木潤，淵生珠而崖不枯。」 「 潤 」亦指雨水。《後漢書‧鍾離意傳》：「而比日密雲，遂無大潤。」 「 潤 」還可表示恩澤。《淮南子‧泰族訓》：「堯治天下，政教平，德潤洽。」 「 潤 」也表示溫潤。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧明詩》：「故平子得其雅，叔夜含其潤。」 「 潤 」也可指財物、好處。明張煌言〈答曹雲林監軍書〉：「徐兄適會弟于阮途，勿克稍為分潤，何梁伯鸞偏遇范萊蕪乎？」
From the sound of " water" and " leap", the original meaning is to moisturize and moisturize. "Shuowen": "Water is said to run down. From the water, leap sound." "Yi‧Shuo Gua": "Wind to disperse, rain to moisten it." " Run" can mean humidity. "Huainanzi‧ Shuo Lin Xun": "Mountains are steamed with clouds, and pillars are moistened." " Run" also means fine and smooth. "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "The jade is in the mountains and the vegetation is moist, the pearls grow in the depths, but the cliffs do not wither." " Run" also refers to rain. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty: The Biography of Zhong Liyi": "However, there is no big run from Miyun in the past." " Run" can also express grace. "Huainanzi·Thai Clan": "Yao rules the world, politics and education are peaceful, and morality is harmonious." " Run" also means warm and moist. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long‧ Ming Poetry": "So Pingzi gets its elegance, and Shu Ye contains its luster." " Run" can also refer to goods and benefits. Zhang Huangyan of the Ming Dynasty "An Answer to Cao Yunlin's Supervision of the Army": "Xu Xiongshi meets the brothers in Ruan Tu, don't make a difference, why Liang Boluan meets Fan Laiwu?"

潤字的基本解释

潤
rùn
见“润”。

潤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［rùn］
［《廣韻》如順切，去稕，日。］
“润1”的繁体字。
(1)滋润；使润湿。
(2)潮湿。
(3)细腻光滑。
(4)雨水；水。
(5)恩泽。
(6)惠及；加惠。
(7)和润；温润。
(8)教化；熏陶。
(9)修饰，加工。
(10)财物；好处。
(11)谓丰厚，充实。
(12)书法用语。指神韵饱满。
(13)水名。淮河的支流。发源于安徽省临泉县，经颍上县西南，于润河集入淮。

潤字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　潤； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页649第24
【唐韻】如順切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】儒順切，?音閏。澤也，滋也，益也。【易·說卦】雨以潤之。　又水名。【水經】淮水，又東北左會潤水。　又水名，出金城。【水經注】潤水，出令居縣西。　又州名。【韻會】漢丹陽郡，隋置潤州。　又黃潤，蜀布名。

潤字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
潤字的起名意思

暂无。

rùn

Run
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［rùn］
["Guangyun" is like Shunqie, go to Jin, day. ]
Traditional characters for "润1".
(1) Moisturize; make moisturizing.
(2) Humidity.
(3) Delicate and smooth.
(4) Rain; water.
(5) Enze.
(6) Benefit; add benefits.
(7) Herun; Wenrun.
(8) Enlightenment; edification.
(9) Modification and processing.
(10) Property; benefits.
(11) It is said to be rich and substantial.
(12) Calligraphy terms. Refers to full of charm.
(13) The name of the water. A tributary of the Huai River. Originated in Linquan County, Anhui Province, through the southwest of Yingshang County, Yurunhe gathers into Huaihe River.
Run
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 1] [Water Word Department] 　Run; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 649 24
[Tang Yun] Such as Shunqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Confucianism Shunqie,? Yin Run. Ze Ye, Zi Ye, Yi Ye. [Easy·Said Gua] Rain is used to moisturize it.　Also known as water. 【Shui Jing】Huaishui River, and the northeast will run water.　Also named as water, out of Jincheng. 【Shui Jing Zhu】Runs water, out of order to live in the west of the county.　Also the name of the state. [Rhyme Club] Danyang County of Han Dynasty, Runzhou of Sui Dynasty.　 Huang Run, Shu cloth name.

Run
Name meaning
Nothing.
rùn
вм. 润
Radicals: 氵, 門, 王  (tsunami, gate, king)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tsunami at the gate of the king makes sure all of his plants get watered. The gate prevents the tsunami from damaging anything inside the king’s home, and the plants around the gate get watered by the water of the tsunami.
Hear the tsunami crash into the gate as you see the water slosh around and make sure that all of the king’s plants get good and watered.
Reading Mnemonic
These plants are getting watered in June (じゅん), the month they need watering the most. June is a hot month, so it’s good that this tsunami came and got the king’s plants watered when it did.
Again, watch and hear the tsunami crashing into the gate and getting the plants watered. This time, remember that the month is June and it is very hot and sticky outside. You’re sweating and very hot.
